comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7b) Gecko/20040325 Firefox/0.8.0+ (MozJF)
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7b) Gecko/20040325 Firefox/0.8.0+ (MozJF)

This bug is strange, and I saw it for about a week.

Nearly all the times, when I close a window which was opened with a Javascript,
Firefox dies.



Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce:
1.Go to a web page that opens a window with a javascript script
2.Get the focus on this window
3.close it

Actual Results:  
nearly all times, Firefox dies

Expected Results:  
Window closed and firefox still alive.

I am using my own homemade build (MozJF's one), based on CVS sources up-to-date
at midnight (mozilla.org time), using this .mozconfig :

 $topsrcdir/browser/config/mozconfig

ac_add_options --disable-tests
ac_add_options --disable-debug
ac_add_options --disable-pedantic
ac_add_options --disable-shared
ac_add_options --enable-static

ac_add_options --disable-activex
ac_add_options --disable-activex-scripting

ac_add_options --enable-optimize='-O1 -G6'

export BUILD_OFFICIAL=1
export MOZILLA_OFFICIAL=1
mk_add_options BUILD_OFFICIAL=1
mk_add_options MOZILLA_OFFICIAL=1 

My compiler is Visual C++ 6.0 Sp5.

I can see this crash using both WinXP-Sp1 or WinXP-Sp2 (rc1)

Please, don't blame me if it is an already known bug... I look at bugzilla, but
I found nothing.
comments.creator: fredbezies@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7b) Gecko/20040325 Firefox/0.8.0+ (MozJF)
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7b) Gecko/20040325 Firefox/0.8.0+ (MozJF)

This bug is strange, and I saw it for about a week.

Nearly all the times, when I close a window which was opened with a Javascript,
Firefox dies.



Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce:
1.Go to a web page that opens a window with a javascript script
2.Get the focus on this window
3.close it

Actual Results:  
nearly all times, Firefox dies

Expected Results:  
Window closed and firefox still alive.

I am using my own homemade build (MozJF's one), based on CVS sources up-to-date
at midnight (mozilla.org time), using this .mozconfig :

 $topsrcdir/browser/config/mozconfig

ac_add_options --disable-tests
ac_add_options --disable-debug
ac_add_options --disable-pedantic
ac_add_options --disable-shared
ac_add_options --enable-static

ac_add_options --disable-activex
ac_add_options --disable-activex-scripting

ac_add_options --enable-optimize='-O1 -G6'

export BUILD_OFFICIAL=1
export MOZILLA_OFFICIAL=1
mk_add_options BUILD_OFFICIAL=1
mk_add_options MOZILLA_OFFICIAL=1 

My compiler is Visual C++ 6.0 Sp5.

I can see this crash using both WinXP-Sp1 or WinXP-Sp2 (rc1)

Please, don't blame me if it is an already known bug... I look at bugzilla, but
I found nothing.
comments.author: fredbezies@gmail.com

comments.creator: fredbezies@gmail.com
comments.text:
Duplicate or related to bug 230557 ?!

Anyway, crash happens when there is a window opened using this kind of code :

<a href="javascript:;" onClick="javascript:window.open('[link of
page]','phone','toolbar=0,location=0,directories=0,status=0,scrollbars=0,resizable=0,copyhistory=0,menuBar=0,width=300,height=162');">

Hope it helps ;o)
comments.raw_text:
Duplicate or related to bug 230557 ?!

Anyway, crash happens when there is a window opened using this kind of code :

<a href="javascript:;" onClick="javascript:window.open('[link of
page]','phone','toolbar=0,location=0,directories=0,status=0,scrollbars=0,resizable=0,copyhistory=0,menuBar=0,width=300,height=162');">

Hope it helps ;o)

about:mozilla ?

Looks like I found a "workaround"... It seems that tinderbox status icon is
guilty here.

I deleted my chrome profile directory, and tested an half-dozen time to crash
firefox, without success...

Looks like my bug is INVALID, because it is not a firefox bug, but a tinderbox
status icon extention bug.

Closing bug as INVALID
